ground_truth: He pulls out a deadly looking dagger, with a sharp point and a triangular shaped blade, and sprints on and Inigo, closing the gap, closer, closer, and he's down the stairs and heading into a dining hall and Count Rugen throws the dagger. Inigo tries like hell to get out of the way, but no, and it sticks deep into his stomach, and he hurtles back helplessly against the wall of the room, his eyes glazed, blood coming from his wound. Count Rugen looks across the room at Inigo, and Inigo sinks. Meanwhile, Buttercup shuts the door of the Honeymoon Suite, crosses quietly to the far wall where she sits at a table, opens a jeweled box, and takes out a very deadly looking dagger. She seems very much at peace as she touches the knife to her bosom and Buttercup whirls as we see Westley lying on the bed. Yellin's sword is beside him. His voice sounds just fine, but he does not move. Buttercup leaps to the bed, covering him with kisses. Westley is helpless, and she lets go, thumping his head against the headboard. Count Rugen looks very much surprised as Inigo, struggling feebly, pulls the dagger from his stomach, holding the wound with his left hand. Rugen pushes off from the table, sword in hand, moving in to kill Inigo. Inigo watches the Count approach, and the Count flicks his sword at Inigo's heart, and there's not much Inigo can do, just kind of vaguely parry the thrust with the six-fingered sword and Count Rugen's blade sinks deeply into Inigo's left shoulder. The Count steps back, going for the heart again, and as this blow comes, Inigo tries to use the wall for support in forcing himself to his feet, and it's not a roaring success of an attempt, but he does at least make some progress, and again he manages to parry the thrust, as this time Rugen's sword runs through his right arm. Again, Inigo doesn't seem to mind, doesn't even feel it. Count Rugen steps back for just a moment, watching as Inigo continues to inch his way to his feet and then, just before the Count is about to strike again, Inigo manages a little flick of his own and Rugen hadn't expected it, and he jumps back, makes a little involuntary cry of surprise. Inigo slowly pushes away from the wall, and Count Rugen suddenly goes into a fierce attack, striking with great power and precision for he is a master swordsman, and he forces Inigo easily back, driving him easily into the wall. But he does not penetrate Inigo's defense. None of the Count's blows get home. As the Count steps back a moment.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He draws out a lethal appearing stiletto, with a keen tip and a three-sided formed blade, and dashes on and Inigo, narrowing the distance, nearer, nearer, and he's down the stairs and advancing into a dining hall and Count Rugen hurls the stiletto. Inigo attempts like hell to get out of the path, but no, and it lodges deep into his abdomen, and he crashes back powerlessly against the partition of the chamber, his eyes dull, blood oozing from his injury. Count Rugen gazes across the chamber at Inigo, and Inigo descends. Meanwhile, Buttercup closes the door of the Honeymoon Suite, moves silently to the distant partition where she places herself at a table, opens a gem-studded container, and extracts a very lethal appearing stiletto. She appears very much at tranquility as she touches the stiletto to her chest and Buttercup spins as we observe Westley reclining on the bed. Yellin's saber is beside him. His voice resonates just fine, but he does not budge. Buttercup springs to the bed, smothering him with kisses. Westley is powerless, and she releases, thumping his cranium against the headboard. Count Rugen appears very much astonished as Inigo, struggling weakly, draws the stiletto from his abdomen, clutching the injury with his left hand. Rugen pushes off from the table, saber in hand, advancing in to slay Inigo. Inigo observes the Count approach, and the Count flicks his saber at Inigo's heart, and there's not much Inigo can do, just sort of hazily deflect the lunge with the six-fingered saber and Count Rugen's blade plunges deeply into Inigo's left shoulder. The Count steps back, aiming for the heart again, and as this strike arrives, Inigo attempts to utilize the partition for support in compelling himself to his feet, and it's not a thunderous success of an effort, but he does at least make some headway, and again he manages to deflect the lunge, as this time Rugen's saber pierces through his right limb. Again, Inigo doesn't seem to care, doesn't even sense it. Count Rugen steps back for just a moment, observing as Inigo continues to inch his way to his feet and then, just before the Count is about to strike again, Inigo executes a small flick of his own and Rugen hadn't anticipated it, and he leaps back, makes a small involuntary cry of astonishment. Inigo slowly pushes away from the partition, and Count Rugen suddenly launches into a ferocious assault, striking with great force and accuracy for he is a master swordsman, and he forces Inigo effortlessly back, propelling him effortlessly into the partition. But he does not breach Inigo's defense. None of the Count's strikes reach home. As the Count steps back a moment.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A deadly-looking dagger, with a sharp point and a triangular-shaped blade, is pulled out by him. The gap is closed by him as he sprints on and toward Inigo, closer, closer, and the stairs are descended by him before he heads into a dining hall, and the dagger is thrown by Count Rugen. Inigo tries desperately to get out of the way, but the dagger sticks deep into his stomach, and he is hurtled helplessly back against the wall of the room, his eyes glazed, with blood coming from his wound. Across the room, Inigo is looked at by Count Rugen, and Inigo sinks. Meanwhile, the door of the Honeymoon Suite is shut by Buttercup, who quietly crosses to the far wall where she sits at a table, a jeweled box is opened by her, and a very deadly-looking dagger is taken out. At peace, she seems as she touches the knife to her bosom, and Buttercup whirls as Westley is seen lying on the bed. Beside him is Yellin's sword. His voice is fine, but movement is absent. Buttercup leaps to the bed, covering him with kisses. Helpless, Westley is as his head is thumped against the headboard by her. Very much surprised, Count Rugen looks as the dagger is pulled from Inigo's stomach by Inigo, who struggles feebly, holding the wound with his left hand. The table is pushed off by Rugen, sword in hand, as he moves in to kill Inigo. The Count is watched by Inigo as he approaches, and Inigo's heart is flicked at by the Count's sword. There's not much that can be done by Inigo, just kind of vaguely parrying the thrust with the six-fingered sword, and Rugen's blade sinks deeply into Inigo's left shoulder. The heart is targeted again by the Count as he steps back, and as this blow comes, the wall is used by Inigo for support in forcing himself to his feet. Though it's not a roaring success of an attempt, some progress is at least made by him, and again the thrust is parried, as this time, Rugen's sword runs through his right arm. Again, Inigo doesn't seem to mind, doesn't even feel it. Count Rugen steps back for just a moment, watching as Inigo continues to inch his way to his feet. Then, just before the Count is about to strike again, a little flick of his own is managed by Inigo, which Rugen hadn't expected, causing him to jump back and make a little involuntary cry of surprise. Away from the wall, Inigo slowly pushes, and a fierce attack is suddenly launched by Count Rugen, striking with great power and precision for he is a master swordsman. Inigo is easily forced back by him, driven easily into the wall. But Inigo’s defense is not penetrated. None of the Count's blows get home. A moment is taken by the Count to step back.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He pulls out a deadly dagger with a sharp point and triangular blade, sprinting as Inigo closes the gap. Down the stairs into a dining hall, Count Rugen throws the dagger. Inigo tries to dodge, but it sticks deep in his stomach, and he crashes against the wall, eyes glazed, bleeding. Count Rugen watches as Inigo sinks. Meanwhile, Buttercup shuts the Honeymoon Suite door, sits at a table, opens a jeweled box, and takes out a deadly dagger. She seems at peace, touching the knife to her bosom, then turns to see Westley on the bed. Yellin's sword is beside him. His voice is fine, but he doesn't move. Buttercup leaps to the bed, covering him with kisses, accidentally thumping his head against the headboard. Count Rugen is surprised as Inigo, struggling, pulls the dagger from his stomach, holding the wound. Rugen, sword in hand, moves to kill Inigo. Inigo watches as the Count flicks his sword at Inigo's heart, vaguely parrying with the six-fingered sword, but Rugen's blade sinks into Inigo's shoulder. The Count steps back, aiming for the heart again. Inigo uses the wall for support, forcing himself up, parrying the thrust as Rugen's sword pierces his arm. Inigo doesn't seem to feel it. Rugen steps back, watching Inigo inch to his feet. Just before the Count strikes again, Inigo flicks his sword, surprising Rugen. Inigo pushes away from the wall, and Rugen attacks fiercely, striking with power and precision, driving Inigo back. But none of the Count's blows penetrate Inigo's defense.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: He pulls out a deadly dagger with a sharp, triangular blade and sprints toward Inigo, closing the gap. Down the stairs into a dining hall, Count Rugen throws the dagger. Inigo tries to dodge, but it sticks deep in his stomach, and he falls against the wall, eyes glazed, bleeding. Count Rugen watches Inigo sink. Meanwhile, Buttercup shuts the Honeymoon Suite door, sits at a table, opens a jeweled box, and takes out a deadly dagger. She touches the knife to her bosom, then sees Westley on the bed, Yellin's sword beside him. She kisses Westley, who is helpless, thumping his head against the headboard. Count Rugen is surprised as Inigo pulls the dagger from his stomach, holding the wound. Rugen, sword in hand, moves to kill Inigo. Inigo parries weakly with the six-fingered sword, but Rugen's blade sinks into Inigo's shoulder. Rugen steps back, aiming for the heart again. Inigo uses the wall to stand, parrying the thrust as Rugen's sword pierces his arm. Inigo doesn't feel it. Rugen steps back, watching Inigo rise. Inigo flicks his sword, surprising Rugen. Inigo pushes from the wall as Rugen attacks fiercely, driving Inigo back, but none of Rugen's blows penetrate Inigo's defense.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He swiftly pulls out a dagger that looks incredibly deadly, with its sharp, menacing point and uniquely triangular-shaped blade. With a burst of speed, he sprints forward, closing the distance between himself and Inigo, getting closer and closer with each stride. He races down the stairs, heading directly into a grand dining hall, and in a sudden, unexpected move, Count Rugen throws the dagger with precision. Inigo desperately tries to evade the incoming weapon, but unfortunately, he cannot, and the dagger embeds itself deeply into his stomach. The force of the impact sends him hurtling backward, helplessly crashing against the wall of the room. His eyes glaze over, and blood begins to flow from his wound. Count Rugen stands across the room, looking at Inigo, who slowly sinks to the floor. Meanwhile, Buttercup quietly shuts the door of the Honeymoon Suite behind her. She crosses the room with a calm demeanor to the far wall, where she sits at a table. There, she opens a jeweled box and takes out a dagger that looks equally deadly. She appears to be at peace as she gently touches the knife to her bosom. Suddenly, Buttercup whirls around, and we see Westley lying on the bed. Yellin's sword is placed beside him. Although his voice sounds perfectly fine, he remains motionless. Buttercup leaps onto the bed, showering him with kisses. Westley is unable to move, and as she lets go, his head thumps against the headboard. Count Rugen, looking quite surprised, watches as Inigo, struggling feebly, manages to pull the dagger from his stomach, using his left hand to hold the wound. Rugen pushes away from the table, sword in hand, advancing with the intent to kill Inigo. Inigo watches the Count approach, and the Count flicks his sword toward Inigo's heart. Inigo can do little more than vaguely parry the thrust with the six-fingered sword, and Count Rugen's blade sinks deeply into Inigo's left shoulder. The Count steps back, preparing to strike at the heart once more. As this blow comes, Inigo uses the wall for support, trying to force himself to his feet. It's not a roaring success of an attempt, but he does make some progress. Once again, he manages to parry the thrust, though this time Rugen's sword runs through his right arm. Inigo seems unfazed, not even feeling the pain. Count Rugen steps back for a brief moment, observing as Inigo continues to inch his way to his feet. Just before the Count is about to strike again, Inigo manages a small flick of his own, catching Rugen off guard. Rugen jumps back, letting out a small, involuntary cry of surprise. Inigo slowly pushes away from the wall, and Count Rugen suddenly launches into a fierce attack, striking with great power and precision, for he is a master swordsman. He forces Inigo back, driving him easily into the wall. However, he does not penetrate Inigo's defense, as none of the Count's blows manage to land. As the Count steps back for a moment, the tension in the room remains palpable.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: He deftly and swiftly draws forth a dagger that appears incredibly lethal, with its terrifyingly sharp and menacing point, complemented by a uniquely crafted triangular-shaped blade. With a sudden burst of speed and energy, he charges forward, rapidly closing the distance that lies between himself and Inigo, inching nearer and nearer with each powerful stride he takes. He races down the staircase, rapidly descending into a grandiose dining hall, and in a sudden, unexpected maneuver, Count Rugen expertly throws the dagger with precise accuracy. Inigo desperately attempts to dodge the oncoming weapon, but, regrettably, he is unable to do so, and the dagger deeply embeds itself into his stomach. The force of the impact propels him backward, causing him to crash helplessly against the room's wall. His eyes quickly glaze over, and blood begins to flow steadily from his wound. Across the room, Count Rugen stands, observing Inigo, who slowly, and with great effort, sinks to the floor. Meanwhile, in a different part of the building, Buttercup quietly closes the door of the Honeymoon Suite behind her. She crosses the room with a serene and calm demeanor, making her way to the far wall, where she proceeds to sit down at a table. There, she opens a beautiful, jeweled box and takes out a dagger that looks equally as deadly. She appears to be at peace as she gently places the knife against her bosom. Suddenly, Buttercup whirls around, revealing Westley lying on the bed. Yellin's sword is placed beside him. Although his voice sounds perfectly fine, Westley remains completely motionless. Buttercup leaps onto the bed, showering him affectionately with kisses. Westley is unable to move, and as she releases him, his head thumps softly against the headboard. Count Rugen, looking quite surprised, observes as Inigo, struggling feebly, manages to pull the dagger out from his stomach, using his left hand to apply pressure to his wound. Rugen pushes away from the table, sword in hand, advancing with the clear intent to kill Inigo. Inigo watches the Count's approach, and the Count flicks his sword toward Inigo's heart. Inigo can manage little more than a vague parry of the attack with the six-fingered sword, and Count Rugen's blade sinks deeply into Inigo's left shoulder. The Count steps back, gathering himself to strike again at the heart. As this blow comes, Inigo relies on the wall for support, making an effort to force himself to his feet. It's not a roaring success of an attempt, but he does make some minor progress. Once again, he manages to parry the thrust, though this time, Rugen's sword runs through his right arm. Inigo seems unfazed, not even registering the pain. Count Rugen takes a step back for a brief moment, observing as Inigo continues to inch his way to his feet. Just before the Count is set to strike once more, Inigo manages a small flick of his own, catching Rugen completely off guard. Rugen jumps back, letting out a small, involuntary cry of surprise. Inigo slowly pushes away from the wall, and Count Rugen suddenly launches into a fierce and aggressive attack, striking with great power and precision, as he is a master swordsman. He forces Inigo backward, driving him with ease into the wall. However, he does not manage to penetrate Inigo's defense, as none of the Count's blows successfully land. As the Count steps back for a moment, the tension in the room remains palpable and intense.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He reaches into his clothing and carefully pulls out a dagger that looks deadly, with a sharp point and a triangular-shaped blade, and then he bursts into a sprint, moving swiftly towards Inigo, closing the distance between them with each stride, getting closer and closer. He descends the stairs rapidly, his feet barely touching the steps, and heads directly into a dining hall. At this moment, Count Rugen, standing at a distance, hurls the dagger with force. Inigo, realizing the imminent danger, desperately attempts to dodge out of the way, but he is unsuccessful, and the dagger embeds itself deeply into his stomach. The impact sends him hurtling backward, and he crashes helplessly against the wall of the room, his eyes glazing over as blood begins to seep from his wound. Count Rugen, standing across the room, fixes his gaze on Inigo, who slowly sinks to the floor. Meanwhile, in a different location, Buttercup quietly shuts the door of the Honeymoon Suite behind her, then crosses the room with soft, deliberate steps to reach the far wall. There, she sits at a table, opens a jeweled box with care, and retrieves a dagger that looks equally deadly. She appears to be at peace as she gently touches the knife to her bosom. Suddenly, Buttercup whirls around, and we see Westley lying motionless on the bed, with Yellin's sword resting beside him. Although his voice sounds perfectly fine, he remains immobile. Buttercup leaps onto the bed, showering him with kisses, but Westley is unable to respond, and as she releases him, his head thumps against the headboard. Back in the dining hall, Count Rugen looks very surprised as Inigo, despite his weakened state, struggles feebly to pull the dagger from his stomach, using his left hand to hold the wound. Rugen, with sword in hand, pushes off from the table and advances with the intent to kill Inigo. Inigo watches the Count approach, and as the Count flicks his sword towards Inigo's heart, Inigo can only vaguely parry the thrust with the six-fingered sword. Count Rugen's blade sinks deeply into Inigo's left shoulder. The Count steps back, preparing to strike at the heart again, and as this blow comes, Inigo attempts to use the wall for support, forcing himself to his feet. Although the attempt is not entirely successful, he makes some progress and manages to parry the thrust once more, even as Rugen's sword runs through his right arm. Inigo seems unfazed, not even feeling the pain. Count Rugen steps back momentarily, observing as Inigo continues to inch his way to his feet. Just before the Count is about to strike again, Inigo manages a small flick of his own, catching Rugen off guard, causing him to jump back with a little involuntary cry of surprise. Inigo slowly pushes away from the wall, and Count Rugen suddenly launches into a fierce attack, striking with great power and precision, demonstrating his mastery as a swordsman. He forces Inigo back easily, driving him into the wall, but despite the ferocity of the attack, none of the Count's blows penetrate Inigo's defense. As the Count steps back for a moment, the scene pauses.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Count Rugen draws a deadly dagger and sprints toward Inigo, closing the distance rapidly. As he descends the stairs into a dining hall, he throws the dagger, which embeds deeply into Inigo's stomach, sending him reeling against the wall, bloodied and dazed. Meanwhile, Buttercup, in the Honeymoon Suite, sits at a table, retrieves a dagger from a jeweled box, and contemplates it with a sense of peace. She turns to see Westley lying on the bed, seemingly fine but immobile, and covers him with kisses, accidentally bumping his head against the headboard. Back in the dining hall, Count Rugen, surprised, watches as Inigo, struggling, pulls the dagger from his stomach and holds his wound. Rugen advances with his sword, aiming to kill Inigo, who weakly parries the thrusts with the six-fingered sword. Despite being wounded in the shoulder and arm, Inigo uses the wall to support himself and manages to flick his sword, catching Rugen off guard. As Inigo slowly regains his footing, Rugen launches a fierce attack, driving Inigo back against the wall, but fails to penetrate his defense.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He pulls out a deadly looking dagger, renowned for its historical use by stealthy assassins, with a sharp point and a triangular shaped blade, and sprints on and Inigo, the skilled swordsman known for his relentless pursuit of vengeance, closing the gap, closer, closer, and he's down the stairs and heading into a dining hall that is lined with ancient tapestries and wooden furniture, and Count Rugen throws the dagger. Inigo tries like hell to get out of the way, but no, and it sticks deep into his stomach, and he hurtles back helplessly against the wall of the room, his eyes glazed, blood coming from his wound. Count Rugen, famous for his cold and calculating demeanor, looks across the room at Inigo, and Inigo sinks. Meanwhile, Buttercup, a princess celebrated for her beauty and grace, shuts the door of the Honeymoon Suite, a luxurious room decorated with fine silks and golden embroidery, crosses quietly to the far wall where she sits at a table, opens a jeweled box from her dowry, and takes out a very deadly looking dagger. She seems very much at peace as she touches the knife to her bosom and Buttercup whirls as we see Westley, known as the Dread Pirate Roberts, lying on the bed. Yellin's sword, a standard military issue in the kingdom, is beside him. His voice sounds just fine, but he does not move. Buttercup leaps to the bed, covering him with kisses. Westley is helpless, and she lets go, thumping his head against the headboard. Count Rugen looks very much surprised as Inigo, struggling feebly, pulls the dagger from his stomach, holding the wound with his left hand. Rugen pushes off from the table, sword in hand, a weapon crafted by the finest swordsmiths in the land, moving in to kill Inigo. Inigo watches the Count approach, and the Count flicks his sword at Inigo's heart, and there's not much Inigo can do, just kind of vaguely parry the thrust with the six-fingered sword, a unique blade that belonged to Rugen himself, and Count Rugen's blade sinks deeply into Inigo's left shoulder. The Count steps back, going for the heart again, and as this blow comes, Inigo tries to use the wall for support in forcing himself to his feet, and it's not a roaring success of an attempt, but he does at least make some progress, and again he manages to parry the thrust, as this time Rugen's sword runs through his right arm. Again, Inigo doesn't seem to mind, doesn't even feel it, fueled by his burning desire for vengeance. Count Rugen steps back for just a moment, watching as Inigo continues to inch his way to his feet and then, just before the Count is about to strike again, Inigo manages a little flick of his own, a fencing move taught to him by his late father, and Rugen hadn't expected it, and he jumps back, makes a little involuntary cry of surprise. Inigo slowly pushes away from the wall, and Count Rugen suddenly goes into a fierce attack, striking with great power and precision for he is a master swordsman, and he forces Inigo easily back, driving him easily into the wall, a tactic often used in duels to gain a strategic advantage. But he does not penetrate Inigo's defense. None of the Count's blows get home. As the Count steps back a moment.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. Count Rugen looks across the room at Inigo and Inigo sinks. Meanwhile Buttercup shuts the door of the Honeymoon Suite crosses quietly to the far wall where she sits at a table opens a jeweled box and takes out a very deadly looking dagger. She seems very much at peace as she touches the knife to her bosom and Buttercup whirls. as we see Westley lying on the bed. Yellin's sword is beside him. His voice sounds just fine but he does not move. Buttercup leaps to the bed covering him with kisses. Westley is helpless and she let us go thumping his head against the headboard. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. Count Rugen looks very much surprised as Inigo struggling feebly pulls the dagger from his stomach holding the wound with his left hand. Rugen pushes off from the table sword in hand moving in to kill Inigo. Inigo watches the Count approach and the Count flicks his sword at Inigo's heart and there is not much Inigo can do just kind of vaguely parry the thrust with the sixfingered sword and Count Rugen's blade sinks deeply into Inigo's left shoulder. The Count steps back going for the heart again and as this blow comes Inigo tries to use the wall for support in forcing himself to his feet and it is not a roaring success of an attempt but he does at least make some progress and again he manages to parry the thrust as this time Rugen's sword runs through his right arm. Again Inigo does not seem to mind does not even feel it. Count Rugen steps back for just a moment watching as Inigo continues to inch his way to his feet and then just before the Count is about to strike again. Inigo manages a little flick of his own and Rugen had not expected it and he jumps back makes a little involuntary cry of surprise. Inigo slowly pushes away from the wall and Count Rugen suddenly goes into a fierce attack striking with great power and precision for he is a master swordsman and he forces Inigo easily back driving him easily into the wall. But he does not penetrate Inigo's defense. None of the Count's blows get home. As the Count steps back a moment.

Inigo tries like hell to get out of the way but no and it sticks deep into his stomach and he hurtles back helplessly against the wall of the room his eyes glazed blood coming from his wound. But he does not penetrate Inigo's defense. None of the Count's blows get home. As the Count steps back a moment.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The giraffe pulls out a deadly looking dagger, with a sharp point and a triangular shaped blade, and sprints on and the kangaroo, closing the gap, closer, closer, and the giraffe's down the stairs and heading into a dining hall and the dolphin throws the dagger. The kangaroo tries like hell to get out of the way, but no, and it sticks deep into the kangaroo's stomach, and the kangaroo hurtles back helplessly against the wall of the room, eyes glazed, blood coming from the wound. The dolphin looks across the room at the kangaroo, and the kangaroo sinks. Meanwhile, the parrot shuts the door of the Honeymoon Suite, crosses quietly to the far wall where the parrot sits at a table, opens a jeweled box, and takes out a very deadly looking dagger. The parrot seems very much at peace as it touches the knife to its bosom and the parrot whirls as we see the panda lying on the bed. The bear's sword is beside him. The panda's voice sounds just fine, but the panda does not move. The parrot leaps to the bed, covering the panda with kisses. The panda is helpless, and the parrot lets go, thumping the panda's head against the headboard. The dolphin looks very much surprised as the kangaroo, struggling feebly, pulls the dagger from its stomach, holding the wound with its left hand. The dolphin pushes off from the table, sword in hand, moving in to kill the kangaroo. The kangaroo watches the dolphin approach, and the dolphin flicks its sword at the kangaroo's heart, and there's not much the kangaroo can do, just kind of vaguely parry the thrust with the six-fingered sword and the dolphin's blade sinks deeply into the kangaroo's left shoulder. The dolphin steps back, going for the heart again, and as this blow comes, the kangaroo tries to use the wall for support in forcing itself to its feet, and it's not a roaring success of an attempt, but the kangaroo does at least make some progress, and again the kangaroo manages to parry the thrust, as this time the dolphin's sword runs through its right arm. Again, the kangaroo doesn't seem to mind, doesn't even feel it. The dolphin steps back for just a moment, watching as the kangaroo continues to inch its way to its feet and then, just before the dolphin is about to strike again, the kangaroo manages a little flick of its own and the dolphin hadn't expected it, and it jumps back, makes a little involuntary cry of surprise. The kangaroo slowly pushes away from the wall, and the dolphin suddenly goes into a fierce attack, striking with great power and precision for it is a master swordsman, and it forces the kangaroo easily back, driving the kangaroo easily into the wall. But it does not penetrate the kangaroo's defense. None of the dolphin's blows get home. As the dolphin steps back a moment.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: He pulls out a deadly looking spear, with a sharp tip and a square-shaped shaft, and sprints on and Inigo, closing the gap, closer, closer, and he's down the hill and heading into a gallery and Count Rugen throws the spear. Inigo tries like hell to get out of the way, but no, and it sticks deep into his chest, and he hurtles back helplessly against the pillar of the room, his eyes glazed, blood coming from his injury. Count Rugen looks across the room at Inigo, and Inigo sinks. Meanwhile, Buttercup shuts the door of the Bridal Suite, crosses quietly to the far wall where she sits at a desk, opens a wooden chest, and takes out a very deadly looking spear. She seems very much at peace as she touches the spear to her bosom and Buttercup whirls as we see Westley lying on the couch. Yellin's lance is beside him. His voice sounds just fine, but he does not move. Buttercup leaps to the couch, covering him with kisses. Westley is helpless, and she lets go, thumping his head against the armrest. Count Rugen looks very much surprised as Inigo, struggling feebly, pulls the spear from his chest, holding the injury with his left hand. Rugen pushes off from the cabinet, mace in hand, moving in to kill Inigo. Inigo watches the Count approach, and the Count flicks his mace at Inigo's heart, and there's not much Inigo can do, just kind of vaguely parry the thrust with the six-fingered club and Count Rugen's mace sinks deeply into Inigo's left shoulder. The Count steps back, going for the heart again, and as this blow comes, Inigo tries to use the bookshelf for support in forcing himself to his feet, and it's not a roaring success of an attempt, but he does at least make some progress, and again he manages to parry the thrust, as this time Rugen's mace runs through his right arm. Again, Inigo doesn't seem to mind, doesn't even feel it. Count Rugen steps back for just a moment, watching as Inigo continues to inch his way to his feet and then, just before the Count is about to strike again, Inigo manages a little flick of his own and Rugen hadn't expected it, and he jumps back, makes a little involuntary cry of surprise. Inigo slowly pushes away from the bookshelf, and Count Rugen suddenly goes into a fierce attack, striking with great power and precision for he is a master mace-wielder, and he forces Inigo easily back, driving him easily into the bookshelf. But he does not penetrate Inigo's defense. None of the Count's blows get home. As the Count steps back a moment.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He pulls out a deadly looking dagger, with a sharp point and a triangular shaped blade, and dances on and Inigo, closing the gap, closer, closer, and he's up the stairs and skipping into a dining hall and Count Rugen tosses the dagger. Inigo tries like hell to jump out of the way, but no, and it clings deep into his stomach, and he bounces back helplessly against the wall of the room, his eyes glazed, blood trickling from his wound. Count Rugen glances across the room at Inigo, and Inigo collapses. Meanwhile, Buttercup opens the door of the Honeymoon Suite, strolls loudly to the far wall where she dances at a table, closes a jeweled box, and throws out a very deadly looking dagger. She seems very much at peace as she brushes the knife to her bosom and Buttercup spins as we see Westley lying on the bed. Yellin's sword is beside him. His voice sounds just fine, but he does not breathe. Buttercup skips to the bed, covering him with hugs. Westley is helpless, and she releases, thumping his head against the pillow. Count Rugen looks very much surprised as Inigo, standing feebly, pushes the dagger from his stomach, holding the wound with his left hand. Rugen drags off from the table, sword in hand, sliding in to tickle Inigo. Inigo observes the Count approach, and the Count taps his sword at Inigo's heart, and there's not much Inigo can do, just kind of vaguely dodge the thrust with the six-fingered sword and Count Rugen's blade grazes deeply into Inigo's left shoulder. The Count skips back, reaching for the heart again, and as this blow comes, Inigo tries to use the wall for support in pulling himself to his feet, and it's not a roaring success of an attempt, but he does at least make some progress, and again he manages to dodge the thrust, as this time Rugen's sword brushes through his right arm. Again, Inigo doesn't seem to mind, doesn't even notice it. Count Rugen skips back for just a moment, observing as Inigo continues to inch his way to his feet and then, just before the Count is about to slash again, Inigo manages a little tap of his own and Rugen hadn't expected it, and he jumps back, makes a little involuntary cry of surprise. Inigo slowly pulls away from the wall, and Count Rugen suddenly jumps into a fierce attack, twirling with great power and precision for he is a master swordsman, and he forces Inigo easily back, bouncing him easily into the wall. But he does not penetrate Inigo's guard. None of the Count's strikes get home. As the Count skips back a moment.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The elevator pulls out a harmless looking umbrella, with a blunt tip and a circular shaped handle, and glides on and the cactus, closing the gap, closer, closer, and it's down the elevator and heading into a laundry room and the librarian throws the umbrella. The cactus tries like hell to get out of the way, but no, and it sticks deep into its elbow, and it hurtles back helplessly against the door of the closet, its eyes glazed, confetti coming from its scratch. The librarian looks across the closet at the cactus, and the cactus sinks. Meanwhile, the teacup shuts the lid of the Breakfast Box, crosses quietly to the near shelf where it sits on a bench, opens a wooden crate, and takes out a very harmless looking umbrella. It seems very much at peace as it touches the umbrella to its handle and the teacup whirls as we see the calendar lying on the carpet. The stapler's pencil is beside it. Its ringtone sounds just fine, but it does not move. The teacup leaps to the carpet, covering it with stickers. The calendar is helpless, and it lets go, thumping its digit against the counterpane. The librarian looks very much surprised as the cactus, struggling feebly, pulls the umbrella from its elbow, holding the scratch with its right knob. The librarian pushes off from the bench, pencil in grip, moving in to tickle the cactus. The cactus watches the librarian approach, and the librarian flicks its pencil at the cactus's belly, and there's not much the cactus can do, just kind of vaguely counter the jab with the ten-pointed pencil and the librarian's pencil sinks deeply into the cactus's right branch. The librarian steps back, going for the belly again, and as this swipe comes, the cactus tries to use the closet for support in forcing itself to its digits, and it's not a roaring success of an attempt, but it does at least make some progress, and again it manages to counter the jab, as this time the librarian's pencil runs through its left branch. Again, the cactus doesn't seem to mind, doesn't even notice it. The librarian steps back for just a moment, watching as the cactus continues to inch its way to its digits and then, just before the librarian is about to swipe again, the cactus manages a little flick of its own and the librarian hadn't expected it, and it jumps back, makes a little involuntary exclamation of surprise. The cactus slowly pushes away from the closet, and the librarian suddenly goes into a timid attack, tapping with slight power and precision for it is a novice pencilman, and it forces the cactus easily back, driving it easily into the door. But it does not penetrate the cactus's protection. None of the librarian's taps get home. As the librarian steps back a moment.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The jester pulls out a peculiar looking stick, with a dull point and a hexagonal shaped shaft, and hops on and Carlos, widening the distance, farther, farther, and he's up the ladder and entering into a ballroom and Lady Miriam tosses the stick. Carlos struggles like mad to stay in the path, but yes, and it grazes past his shoulder, and he floats forward gracefully against the pillar of the hall, his eyes wide open, sweat dripping from his brow. Lady Miriam glances across the hall at Carlos, and Carlos rises. Meanwhile, Fanny locks the window of the Honeymoon Suite, strolls gently to the nearby shelf where she stands by a chair, opens a silver box, and takes out a rather gentle looking feather. She seems very much composed as she presses the feather to her cheek and Fanny turns abruptly as we see Robert reclining on the couch. Amanda's book is beside him. His voice sounds just grand, but he does not stir. Fanny dives to the couch, showering him with flowers. Robert is motionless, and she releases, nudging his shoulder against the cushions. Lady Miriam looks very much confused as Carlos, struggling feebly, tugs the stick from his shoulder, holding the graze with his right hand. Miriam leans away from the chair, feather in hand, advancing to tickle Carlos. Carlos watches Lady draw near, and the Lady waves her feather at Carlos's chest, and there's not much Carlos can do, just kind of vaguely swat the gesture with the three-fingered glove and Lady Miriam's feather tickles deeply onto Carlos's right hip. The Lady sidesteps, reaching for the chest again, and as this gesture comes, Carlos tries to use the pillar for leverage in pulling himself upright, and it's not a soaring success of an attempt, but he does at least make some headway, and once more he manages to swat the gesture, as this time Miriam's feather brushes past his left elbow. Again, Carlos doesn't seem to notice, doesn't even acknowledge it. Lady Miriam slides away for just a second, observing as Carlos continues to creep his way upright and then, just before the Lady is about to poke again, Carlos manages a little wave of his own and Miriam hadn't anticipated it, and she reels back, lets out a small involuntary laugh of surprise. Carlos gently drifts away from the pillar, and Lady Miriam abruptly shifts into a spirited dance, moving with great flair and accuracy for she is a master dancer, and she guides Carlos effortlessly back, leading him gently into the pillar. But she does not crack Carlos's resolve. None of the Lady's gestures find purchase. As the Lady pauses a moment.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He extracts a formidable-looking whisk, with a blunt end and a rectangular handle, and hops on and Inigo, closing the distance, nearer, nearer, and he's up the ladder and heading into a ballroom and Count Rugen flings the whisk. Inigo struggles mightily to dodge, but no, and it embeds firmly into his thigh, and he tumbles forward helplessly against the curtain of the space, his eyes unfocused, ink oozing from his scratch. Count Rugen peers across the space at Inigo, and Inigo crumples. Meanwhile, Buttercup gently closes the window of the Library nook, tiptoes silently to the nearby chair where she sits at a desk, opens a wooden crate, and retrieves a very fierce-looking spatula. She appears completely tranquil as she presses the spatula to her chest and Buttercup spins as we see Westley lounging on the sofa. Yellin's spoon is beside him. His voice sounds perfectly well, but he does not stir. Buttercup bounds to the sofa, smothering him with hugs. Westley is powerless, and she lets go, knocking his head against the armrest. Count Rugen looks utterly astonished as Inigo, writhing weakly, extracts the whisk from his thigh, clutching the scratch with his right hand. Rugen pushes off from the stand, spoon in hand, advancing in to tickle Inigo. Inigo observes the Count advance, and the Count swishes his spoon at Inigo's knee, and there's not much Inigo can do, just sort of awkwardly dodge the flick with the four-fingered spatula and Count Rugen's utensil smacks deeply into Inigo's right elbow. The Count retreats, aiming for the knee again, and as this swing comes, Inigo attempts to use the curtain for leverage in pulling himself upright, and it's not a roaring success of a try, but he does at least make some headway, and again he manages to dodge the flick, as this time Rugen's spoon pierces through his left hand. Again, Inigo doesn't seem to notice, doesn't even register it. Count Rugen retreats for a brief instant, observing as Inigo persists in nudging his way to a standing position and then, just before the Count is about to swipe again, Inigo executes a small flick of his own and Rugen hadn't foreseen it, and he skips back, makes a small involuntary sound of surprise. Inigo gradually pushes away from the curtain, and Count Rugen suddenly launches a vigorous onslaught, swinging with great power and accuracy for he is a master spoon wielder, and he forces Inigo effortlessly backward, propelling him effortlessly into the curtain. But he does not breach Inigo's defense. None of the Count's swings make contact. As the Count retreats for a moment.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat extracts a shiny-looking feather, with a blunt end and a circular-shaped stem, and hops forward, and Lucy, bridging the distance, nearer, nearer, and she's up the ladder and diving into a drawing room, and General Puff tosses the feather. Lucy struggles to slide away, but alas, and it embeds deeply into her leg, and she cartwheels backward helplessly against the shelf of the library, her gaze cloudy, sap oozing from her bruise. General Puff glances across the library at Lucy, and Lucy droops. Meanwhile, Petal bolts the window of the Garden Nook, crawls swiftly to the near shelf where she kneels at a bench, unveils a crystal chest, and extracts a beautifully polished feather. She appears very calm as she brushes the feather to her ankle, and Petal spins as we observe Willow reclining on the couch. Bruno's flute rests next to him. His tone seems just fair, but he does not twitch. Petal vaults to the couch, peppering him with nibbles. Willow is frozen, and she releases, bumping his chin against the cushion. General Puff appears quite startled as Lucy, floundering weakly, extracts the feather from her leg, clutching the bruise with her right hand. Puff shoves off from the bench, flute in paw, advancing in to tickle Lucy. Lucy observes the General advancing, and the General twirls his flute at Lucy's chest, and there's little Lucy can achieve, just sort of hazily block the gesture with the two-pronged flute, and General Puff's stem pierces deeply into Lucy's right shoulder. The General retreats, aiming for the chest again, and as this strike lands, Lucy strives to utilize the shelf for leverage in pushing herself upright, and it's not a triumphant attempt, but she does at least make some headway, and again she manages to block the gesture, as this time Puff's flute pierces her left paw. Still, Lucy seems indifferent, doesn't even sense it. General Puff withdraws briefly, observing as Lucy continues to inch herself upright, and then, just as the General is about to strike once more, Lucy executes a slight swipe of her own, surprising Puff, and he leaps backward, emitting a small involuntary shout of astonishment. Lucy gradually pushes away from the shelf, and General Puff abruptly launches a fierce assault, jabbing with immense force and accuracy for he is an adept flutist, and he drives Lucy casually backward, propelling her effortlessly into the shelf. But he does not breach Lucy's blockade. None of the General's taps reach the mark. As the General pauses for an instant.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Count Rugen attacks Inigo with a deadly dagger, which lodges deep in Inigo's stomach, causing him to fall back against a wall, wounded and bleeding. At the same time, Buttercup sits peacefully with a dagger poised at her chest but turns her attention to Westley, who is motionless on the bed. She covers him with kisses despite his helpless state. Meanwhile, Inigo, struggling but determined, pulls the dagger from his wound as Count Rugen approaches, sword in hand, ready to kill. Weakened but resolute, Inigo parries the Count’s fierce attacks, despite being struck in the shoulder and arm. He gradually gains footing, surprising Rugen with a defensive flick. Although Inigo is pushed back by Rugen, a master swordsman, he successfully maintains his defense, thwarting the Count's efforts.

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: Rugen pushes off from the table sword in hand moving in to kill Inigo  Inigo watches the Count approach and the Count flicks his sword at Inigo's heart and there's not much Inigo can do just kind of vaguely parry the thrust with the sixfingered sword and Count Rugen's blade sinks deeply into Inigo's left shoulder  The Count steps back going for the heart again and as this blow comes Inigo tries to use the wall for support in forcing himself to his feet and it's not a roaring success of an attempt but he does at least make some progress and again he manages to parry the thrust as this time Rugen's sword runs through his right arm  Again Inigo doesn't seem to mind doesn't even feel it  Count Rugen steps back for just a moment watching as Inigo continues to inch his way to his feet and then just before the Count is about to strike again Inigo manages a little flick of his own and Rugen hadn't expected it and he jumps back makes a little involuntary cry of surprise  Inigo slowly pushes away from the wall and Count Rugen suddenly goes into a fierce attack striking with great power and precision for he is a master swordsman and he forces Inigo easily back driving him easily into the wall  But he does not penetrate Inigo's defense  None of the Count's blows  get home  As the Count steps back a moment He pulls out a deadly looking dagger with a sharp point and a triangular shaped blade and sprints on and Inigo closing the gap closer closer and he's down the stairs and heading into a dining hall and Count Rugen throws the dagger  Inigo tries like hell to get out of the way but no and it sticks deep into his stomach and he hurtles back helplessly against the wall of the room his eyes glazed blood coming from his wound  Count Rugen looks across the room at Inigo and Inigo sinks  Meanwhile Buttercup shuts the door of the Honeymoon Suite crosses quietly to the far wall where she sits at a table opens a jeweled box and takes out a very deadly looking dagger  She seems very much at peace as she touches the knife to her bosom and Buttercup whirls  as we see Westley lying on the bed  Yellin's sword is beside him  His voice sounds just fine but he does not move  Buttercup leaps to the bed covering him with kisses  Westley is helpless and she lets go thumping his head against the headboard  Count Rugen looks very much surprised as Inigo struggling feebly pulls the dagger from his stomach holding the wound with his left hand
